intro: Isodon excisus, commonly known as the cut-leaved germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. Isodon excisus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
